page.title: 03Scottish Examination Board
page.content:
The Scottish Examination Board (SEB) has been based in Dalkeith since 1975 being moved there because of the need for larger premises brought about by the increased number of candidates sitting examinations after the leaving age was raised to 16 in 1971. The SEB was set up originally by the Government in 1963 to run external examinations for Scottish children, up to the age of 18, attending day-time schools.
In 1984 145,839 candidates sat between them 644,421 exams at Ordinary Grade, Higher Grade and in 6th Year Studies. The SEB employed approximately 4,000 teachers to mark these.
